[Home](./index.md) &gt; [jest-remirror](./jest-remirror.md)

## jest-remirror package

## Classes

|  Class | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [TagTracker](./jest-remirror.tagtracker.md) | ProseMirror doesn't support empty text nodes, making it difficult to capture a tagged position without introducing text.<!-- -->E.g.:<!-- -->p('<cursor>') p('Hello ', '<cursor>', 'world!')<!-- -->After the tagged syntax is stripped we're left with:<!-- -->p('') p('Hello ', '', 'world!')<!-- -->This violates the rule of text nodes being non-empty. This class solves the problem by providing an alternative data structure that \*only\* stores tags, and can be used in scenarios where an empty text would be forbidden.<!-- -->This is done under the hood when using <code>text()</code> factory, and instead of always returning a text node, it'll instead return one of two things:<!-- -->- a text node -- when given a non-empty string - a tag tracker -- when given a string that \*only\* contains tags. |

## Interfaces

|  Interface | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [AddContentReturn](./jest-remirror.addcontentreturn.md) |  |
|  [BaseFactoryParams](./jest-remirror.basefactoryparams.md) |  |
|  [CreateTestEditorExtensions](./jest-remirror.createtesteditorextensions.md) |  |
|  [TaggedProsemirrorNode](./jest-remirror.taggedprosemirrornode.md) | A standard ProseMirror Node that also tracks tags. |
|  [Tags](./jest-remirror.tags.md) | A useful feature of the builder is being able to declaratively mark positions in content using the angled braces e.g. <code>&lt;cursor&gt;</code>.<!-- -->These positions are called tags, and are tracked on every node in the tree that has a tag on any of its descendants. |

## Variables

|  Variable | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [clean](./jest-remirror.clean.md) | Builds a 'clean' version of the nodes, without Tags or TagTrackers |
|  [coerce](./jest-remirror.coerce.md) | Coerce builder content into tagged nodes.<!-- -->Checks if the content item is a string and runs the text transformer otherwise passes a flattened structure through to the <code>sequence</code> function |
|  [fragment](./jest-remirror.fragment.md) | Flatten all passed content. |
|  [ignoreJSDOMWarnings](./jest-remirror.ignorejsdomwarnings.md) | There are a few warnings about unsupported JSDOM APIS. Calling this function with true turns them all off. |
|  [jsdomExtras](./jest-remirror.jsdomextras.md) | To fix Prosemirror tests in jsdom |
|  [jsdomPolyfill](./jest-remirror.jsdompolyfill.md) | Polyfill DOMElement.innerText because JSDOM lacks support for it. See [https://github.com/tmpvar/jsdom/issues/1245](https://github.com/tmpvar/jsdom/issues/1245) |
|  [markFactory](./jest-remirror.markfactory.md) | Create a builder function for marks. |
|  [nodeExtensions](./jest-remirror.nodeextensions.md) | All the required and core extensions for testing |
|  [nodeFactory](./jest-remirror.nodefactory.md) | Create a builder function for nodes. |
|  [offsetTags](./jest-remirror.offsettags.md) | Offset tag position values by some amount. |
|  [remirrorMatchers](./jest-remirror.remirrormatchers.md) |  |
|  [renderEditor](./jest-remirror.rendereditor.md) | Render the editor with the params passed in. Useful for testing. |
|  [renderSSREditor](./jest-remirror.renderssreditor.md) | Render the editor with the params passed in. Useful for testing. |
|  [replaceSelection](./jest-remirror.replaceselection.md) | Replace the current selection with the given content, which may be string, a fragment, node, or array of nodes. |
|  [sequence](./jest-remirror.sequence.md) | Given a collection of nodes, sequence them in an array and return the result along with the updated tags. |
|  [setupRemirrorEnvironment](./jest-remirror.setupremirrorenvironment.md) |  |
|  [slice](./jest-remirror.slice.md) |  |
|  [text](./jest-remirror.text.md) | Create a text node.<!-- -->Special markers called <code>tags</code> can be put in the text. Tags provide a way to declaratively describe a position within some text, and then access the position in the resulting node. |
